p: The glycoflavonoids kaempferol-3- O-β- d-glucopyranoside ( 50), and quercetin-3- O-β- d-glucopyranoside ( 51), Fig. 12, were isolated from the leaves of Ekebergia capensis (Meliaceae) from Kenya by Irungu et al. [ 80]. Both compounds were observed to possess moderate activities against the D6 and W2 strains of P. falciparum. The IC 50 values of compounds 50 and 51 were, respectively, 97.1 and 42.9 µM against the D6 strain, while both compounds measured an IC 50 value of 105.8 µM against the W2 strain.
